page.title: 16RACEHORSES
page.content: Caroline's father helps to breed {racehorses}for Her Majesty the Queen's Representative at Royal Ascot. Caroline's father said that, "When you are looking for a good horse you look for a kind eye, plenty of bone and an athletic walk.In winter they are fed four times a day on Australian oats,bran,flaked maize,race nuts,boiled linseed andgood hay.The average size of a racehorse is 16 hands and the average size of it's {stable}is 14' by 12'.Flat racehorses start{racing}when they are two years old.{Steeplechasers}start at five years of age.Steeplechasing got it's name from years ago when people would race across country using church steeples as landmarks. When the horses race they have to have special racing plates (shoes) made of aluminium so they can race faster."
